name: libmobi
description: C library for handling Kindle (MOBI) formats of ebook documents

repo.name: libmobi
repo.description: C library for handling Kindle (MOBI) formats of ebook documents

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and installation instructions with a comprehensive code example, but lacks configuration details and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section - common errors, debugging tips, or FAQ for issues users might encounter when parsing MOBI files

injection_risks.description: Use of mobi_buffer_getstring without validation may lead to buffer overflow
Use of malloc without checking for NULL return value may lead to memory leaks or crashes

critical_findings: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in mobi_buffer_getstring function
Memory leaks or crashes due to unhandled malloc failures
security.summary: The libmobi package has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of input validation, but no critical secrets exposure or dangerous defaults were found.

common_complaints: MOBI to EPUB conversion produces invalid XML with unresolved namespace references
Windows build compatibility issues with libxml2 and compiler flags
Missing features for selective format extraction in mobitool
Character encoding/display issues with non-ASCII text
sentiment.summary: The project shows moderate maintenance activity with responsive issue resolution, though users encounter platform-specific build challenges and format conversion edge cases that warrant attention.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and patient, with a good balance of technical depth and encouragement for new contributors.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months
No active contributors in the past 6 months
No merged PRs in the past 6 months
No closed issues in the past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests lack of versioning activity
positive_signals: Repository still exists and has not been archived
Open issues indicate some user engagement
maintenance.summary: libmobi shows clear signs of staleness with no development activity, contributor engagement, or issue resolution over the past 6 months.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally clear and provides a good overview of the library's features, but could benefit from more examples and troubleshooting information.
concerns: No commits in the past six months
Only one merged PR in the past six months
Docs: Lack of comprehensive troubleshooting section
Community: Converting mobi file to epub results in invalid XML containing mbp page breaks
Community: Building on Windows fails with libxml2.lib(libxml2.dll) : error LNK2005
Security: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in mobi_buffer_getstring function
Security: Memory leaks or crashes due to unhandled malloc failures
High bus factor risk (100% from top contributor)
highlights: Three contributors have been active in the past six months
